page.title: 15N. Baddersley Gospel Church
page.content: The church is built out of house bricks and looks like a sports hall and not a church. There has been a church in North Baddersley's Nutburn Rd for 98 years, although the original church was only a wooden building. It was expanded backwards from the road 25 years ago and has been widened for a year. Inside the church has a video camera and all the equipment needed to go with it including large television screens in the adjoining room, to show services to those who cannot seeit from the main room. Pastor Ron White is the man 'in control' and there is also an evangalist called Dave Deeney. About 250 people attend the services on Sunday and the different activities during the week draw a good attendence as well.Songs during services are aided by drums, trumpets, and electric organ, unlike traditional services.
